meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the evolutionary changes in the species over many years.
meanings.sent2: The evolutionary process of natural selection leads to the adaptation of organisms.
meanings.sent3: The evolutionary theory made the history class more interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic skills showed an evolutionary growth from her first painting to the latest masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The evolutionary patterns in nature are fascinating to observe.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to gradual development or change over time.
meanings.sent1: The company implemented an evolutionary approach to improve its products slowly.
meanings.sent2: The city's skyline underwent an evolutionary transformation with the construction of new buildings.
meanings.sent3: The evolutionary pace of the snail race amused the spectators.
meanings.sent4: His ideas went through an evolutionary process before becoming a groundbreaking invention.
meanings.sent5: The evolutionary growth of technology has changed the way we communicate.
